entry.title: SAP Composable Storefront: Correct steps to move from B2C to B2B setup
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need some guidance on the correct approach to move from a B2C Composable Storefront to a B2B Composable Storefront in SAP Commerce.

Current situation:

  • I initially installed and developed a B2C Composable Storefront.

  • Later, I realized that B2C is no longer needed and the project must be B2B only.

  • I have already created a new B2B Composable Storefront installation in a separate folder.

  • I want to keep all the custom work done in the B2C storefront (custom components, services, CMS components, styles, configurations) and reuse it in the B2B storefront.

Questions:

  1. What are the recommended and SAP-supported steps to move from a B2C Composable Storefront to B2B?

  2. Is there any official documentation or best practice that explains this transition?

Goal:
End up with a single B2B Composable Storefront, fully functional, containing all the customizations originally developed for B2C, and aligned with SAP best practices to avoid future upgrade issues.

 

Thank you in advance.

Stefania

How can we define this notification process?

Thanks,

entry.title: Expired Product Management in Medical Device Industry using S/4HANA
entry.content:
Introduction:  

This blog outlines th leading medical device industry business process steps to return expired products from the field and to replenish for the depleted stocks due to return of expired products.

In the field instruments and implants can expire for various reasons, companies regularly monitor products on the field for expiration and pull them of the shelves and replenish them with new stocks. This process prevents expired products from reaching the customers.

Pre-requisite:

  • The goods due expiration in the field consigned to customers or branch
  • The materials are tracked using reports generated out of S4
  • Hospitals and branches must be set up as customers
  • Instruments and Consumables set up separate materials.

Process Flow:

 

Process Flow: Replenishment

Process Flow: Return Expired

 Setup Steps:

Configure new consignment document type: -

Step 1: Define Consignment fill up and pick up document types

SPRO – Sales and Distribution – Sales document- Sales document header – Define sales document type.

Consignment Pick up – To pick up inventory from branch A back to the warehouse and virtual storage location

Consignment Fill up. – To deliver inventory to sales rep B

Step 2: Define item categories.

SPRO – Sales and Distribution – Sales document- Sales document item – Define item categories

Consignment pick-up item category

Consignment Fill-up Item category.

Step 3: Schedule lines

SPRO – Sales and Distribution – Sales document- Schedule lines – Define schedule lines.

Consignment Pickup Schedule line.


Consignment Fill up the schedule line

Step 4: Assign document type to the sales area.

SPRO – Sales and Distribution – Sales document- Sales document header – Assign Sales Area to Sales Document Types

Step 5: Assign Item Categories

SPRO – Sales and Distribution – Sales document- Sales document item - Assign Item Categories

Step 6: Assign Schedule Line Categories

SPRO – Sales and Distribution – Sales document- Schedule lines - Assign Schedule Line Categories

Process steps: -

Step 1: - Create pick up order (KA) To pick up inventory from branch A


Step 2: Create Inbound delivery and receive goods in the warehouse of origin and virtual storage location.

Step 3. Create a Consignment fill up (KB) order transfer/deliver goods to branch B

Step 4: Create an outbound delivery with reference to the KB Order. Pick, pack, and Issue from the virtual storage location to rep B

Step 5: Asset updated with the new functional location


Conclusion:

  • After going through the above blog, the user should have learned how to pull back expired products from the field and replenish them with new stock in S4 HANA
  • Please provide your feedback/comments. You can ask Question / Answer for the open Questions in the SAP Community here

Reference:

 SAP Help Portal

Authors: Mohan Kaliyamoorthy and Immanuel Godwin Johnson

entry.title: Re: Customizing SAP EWM Warehouse Monitor Node
entry.content:
Hello @GK817 ,

First of all sorry the late answer. 

According to me, the availability of the node (out of the box solution) to create customized monitor is enough basis to state that this is a SAP recommended solution.

You can either copy the SAP standard monitor or create a custom one straight from scratch. In both cases; you copy as is and not change anything (I cannot imagine why you would) or change anything, it would still be a SAP standard copy; Same like you copy the customizing of SAP out the box delivered standard Warehouse 0001.

Based on my recent project experience, I can confirm that the updates do not flow to the custom monitor. You need to add the extra Object Class and Methods which are delivered by SAP as a part of upgrade to your custom monitor .

entry.title: Re: The Only Script you would ever need for Message Logging and Custom Headers in SAP CI
entry.content:
Hello @vinaymittal,Why are you providing Groovy scripts that do not follow best practices?


Reading the message body as a String causes unnecessary high memory consumption. As a best practice, you should always guide your audience to use InputStream instead, especially in SAP CPI, where payload sizes can be large and memory management is critical.


Please make corrections whenever possible and improve the examples to reflect recommended best practices.

entry.title: Re: Proactive Warranty Monitoring in SAP PM: A Custom ABAP Solution
entry.content:
Hi Jelena, sorry about that. I gladly provide you with the entire code. 

REPORT y_pm_gewaehrl_ende_liste.

TABLES: iflot, equi.

TYPES: BEGIN OF zgewaehr_line,
         objektart TYPE char10,
         nummer    TYPE char30,
         beginn    TYPE sy-datum,
         ende      TYPE sy-datum,
         resttage  TYPE i,
         status    TYPE char40,
       END OF zgewaehr_line.

DATA: lv_today  TYPE sy-datum,
      lv_days   TYPE i,
      lv_start  TYPE sy-datum,
      lv_end    TYPE sy-datum,
      lt_output TYPE TABLE OF zgewaehr_line,
      ls_output TYPE zgewaehr_line,
      lv_mail_needed TYPE abap_bool.

lv_today = sy-datum.

" Selektionsbildschirm
SELECT-OPTIONS: s_tplnr FOR iflot-tplnr,
                s_equnr FOR equi-equnr.
PARAMETERS: p_rest  TYPE i DEFAULT 90 OBLIGATORY, " Standard 90 Tage
            p_email TYPE ad_smtpadr LOWER CASE,
            p_send  AS CHECKBOX DEFAULT ' '.

START-OF-SELECTION.

  " --- Technische Plätze ---
  IF s_tplnr[] IS NOT INITIAL.
    SELECT tplnr, objnr
      FROM iflot
      INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_tpl)
      WHERE tplnr IN @s_tplnr.

    LOOP AT lt_tpl INTO DATA(ls_tpl).
      CLEAR: lv_start, lv_end, ls_output.

      SELECT SINGLE gwldt, gwlen
        FROM bgmkobj
        INTO (@lv_start, @LV_end)
        WHERE j_objnr = @LS_tpl-objnr.

      IF lv_start IS INITIAL OR lv_end IS INITIAL.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      ls_output-objektart = 'TPL'.
      ls_output-nummer    = ls_tpl-tplnr.
      ls_output-beginn    = lv_start.
      ls_output-ende      = lv_end.

      lv_days = lv_end - lv_today.
      ls_output-resttage = lv_days.

      IF lv_today >= lv_start AND lv_today <= lv_end.
        ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung vorhanden'.
      ELSEIF lv_today > lv_end.
        ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung abgelaufen'.
      ELSE.
        ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung noch nicht gültig'.
      ENDIF.

      " Nur innerhalb Restlaufzeit und nicht abgelaufen
      IF lv_days >= 0 AND lv_days <= p_rest.
        APPEND ls_output TO lt_output.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

  " --- Equipment ---
  IF s_equnr[] IS NOT INITIAL.
    SELECT equnr, objnr
      FROM equi
      INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_equi)
      WHERE equnr IN @s_equnr.

    LOOP AT lt_equi INTO DATA(ls_equi).
      CLEAR: lv_start, lv_end, ls_output.

      SELECT SINGLE gwldt, gwlen
        FROM bgmkobj
        INTO (@lv_start, @LV_end)
        WHERE j_objnr = @LS_equi-objnr.

      IF lv_start IS INITIAL OR lv_end IS INITIAL.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      ls_output-objektart = 'EQ'.
      ls_output-nummer    = ls_equi-equnr.
      ls_output-beginn    = lv_start.
      ls_output-ende      = lv_end.

      lv_days = lv_end - lv_today.
      ls_output-resttage = lv_days.

      IF lv_today >= lv_start AND lv_today <= lv_end.
        ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung vorhanden'.
      ELSEIF lv_today > lv_end.
        ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung abgelaufen'.
      ELSE.
        ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung noch nicht gültig'.
      ENDIF.

      " Nur innerhalb Restlaufzeit und nicht abgelaufen
      IF lv_days >= 0 AND lv_days <= p_rest.
        APPEND ls_output TO lt_output.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

  " --- LIST-Ausgabe ---
  WRITE: / 'Objektart', 12 'Nummer', 32 'Beginn', 52 'Ende', 72 'Resttage', 82 'Status'.
  ULINE.

  LOOP AT lt_output INTO ls_output.
    IF ls_output-status = 'Gewährleistung vorhanden'.
      FORMAT COLOR COL_POSITIVE INTENSIFIED ON. " Grün
    ELSEIF ls_output-resttage <= p_rest OR lv_today > ls_output-ende.
      FORMAT COLOR COL_NEGATIVE INTENSIFIED ON. " Rot
    ELSE.
      FORMAT COLOR COL_NORMAL INTENSIFIED OFF.
    ENDIF.

    WRITE: / ls_output-objektart UNDER 'Objektart',
             ls_output-nummer    UNDER 'Nummer',
             ls_output-beginn    UNDER 'Beginn',
             ls_output-ende      UNDER 'Ende',
             ls_output-resttage  UNDER 'Resttage',
             ls_output-status    UNDER 'Status'.

    FORMAT COLOR OFF.
  ENDLOOP.

  " --- Prüfen, ob Mail nötig ---
  lv_mail_needed = abap_false.
  LOOP AT lt_output INTO ls_output.
    IF ls_output-resttage < 90.
      lv_mail_needed = abap_true.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.

  " --- Mailversand ---
  IF p_send = 'X' AND p_email IS NOT INITIAL AND lv_mail_needed = abap_true.
    PERFORM send_email USING p_email lt_output.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Mailversand
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM send_email USING pv_email TYPE ad_smtpadr pt_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE.
  DATA: lv_body      TYPE string,
        lv_line      TYPE string,
        lt_mail_body TYPE soli_tab,
        ls_mail_line TYPE soli.

  lv_body = 'Gewährleistungen die in den nächsten 90 Tagen enden.:' && cl_abap_char_utilities=>cr_lf.

  LOOP AT pt_data INTO ls_output.
    lv_line = |{ ls_output-objektart } { ls_output-nummer } Beginn: { ls_output-beginn DATE = USER } Ende: { ls_output-ende DATE = USER } Resttage: { ls_output-resttage } Status: { ls_output-status }|.
    CONCATENATE lv_body lv_line cl_abap_char_utilities=>cr_lf INTO lv_body.
  ENDLOOP.

  SPLIT lv_body AT cl_abap_char_utilities=>cr_lf INTO TABLE DATA(lt_lines).
  LOOP AT lt_lines INTO DATA(lv_text).
    ls_mail_line-line = lv_text.
    APPEND ls_mail_line TO lt_mail_body.
  ENDLOOP.

  TRY.
      DATA(lo_send_request) = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).
      DATA(lo_document)     = cl_document_bcs=>create_document(
                                i_type    = 'RAW'
                                i_text    = lt_mail_body
                                i_subject = 'SAP Systemnachricht: Gewährleistungen laufen aus.' ).
      lo_send_request->set_document( lo_document ).
      lo_send_request->add_recipient( cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( pv_email ) ).
      lo_send_request->set_send_immediately( 'X' ).
      DATA(lv_sent) = lo_send_request->send( ).
      IF lv_sent = abap_false.
        MESSAGE 'Mail konnte nicht gesendet werden' TYPE 'E'.
      ENDIF.
      COMMIT WORK.
    CATCH cx_document_bcs INTO DATA(lx_doc).
      MESSAGE lx_doc->get_text( ) TYPE 'E'.
  ENDTRY.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Re: Fixing Warranty Inheritance Issues in SAP PM: A Custom ABAP Report
entry.content:
complete code: 

REPORT y_pm_tp_inherit_warranty.

PARAMETERS: p_tplnr TYPE iflot-tplnr OBLIGATORY,
            p_test  AS CHECKBOX DEFAULT abap_true.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_child,
         tplnr TYPE iflot-tplnr,
         objnr TYPE iflot-objnr,
       END OF ty_child.

DATA: lv_objnr_parent      TYPE iflot-objnr,
      lt_child             TYPE TABLE OF ty_child,
      lv_pattern           TYPE string,
      lv_status            TYPE string,
      wa_bgmkobj_parent    TYPE bgmkobj,
      wa_bgmkobj_child     TYPE bgmkobj.

" Authorization check notice
AUTHORITY-CHECK OBJECT 'I_FL' ID 'TPLNR' FIELD p_tplnr ID 'ACTVT' FIELD '02'.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  WRITE: / 'Notice: Authorization check failed. Please verify permissions.'.
ENDIF.


" 1. Read parent functional location
SELECT SINGLE objnr
  FROM iflot
  INTO @LV_objnr_parent
  WHERE tplnr = @p_tplnr.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  MESSAGE 'Parent functional location not found' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.


" 2. Read warranty data for parent location
SELECT SINGLE *
  FROM bgmkobj
  INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF @wa_bgmkobj_parent
  WHERE j_objnr = @LV_objnr_parent.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  MESSAGE 'No warranty data found for parent location' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.


" 3. Read child locations
lv_pattern = p_tplnr && '%'.

SELECT tplnr, objnr
  FROM iflot
  INTO TABLE @LT_child
  WHERE tplnr LIKE @LV_pattern
    AND tplnr <> @p_tplnr.

IF lt_child IS INITIAL.
  MESSAGE 'No subordinate functional locations found' TYPE 'I'.
ENDIF.

WRITE: / 'Parent location:', p_tplnr,
       / 'Test run:', p_test.


" 4. Process child locations using MODIFY
LOOP AT lt_child ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<child>).
  IF p_test = abap_true.
    lv_status = |SIMULATION: Location { <child>-tplnr } would be updated or newly created.|.
  ELSE.
    CLEAR wa_bgmkobj_child.
    wa_bgmkobj_child = wa_bgmkobj_parent.
    wa_bgmkobj_child-j_objnr = <child>-objnr;
    wa_bgmkobj_child-erdat   = sy-datum.
    wa_bgmkobj_child-erzei   = sy-uzeit.
    wa_bgmkobj_child-gaerb   = 'X'.

    " MODIFY decides whether INSERT or UPDATE
    MODIFY bgmkobj FROM @wa_bgmkobj_child.

    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      lv_status = |Location { <child>-tplnr } processed successfully.|.
    ELSE.
      lv_status = |Error processing location { <child>-tplnr }.|.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.

  WRITE: / lv_status.
ENDLOOP.

IF p_test = abap_false.
  COMMIT WORK.
  WRITE: / 'Changes have been saved.'.
ELSE.
  WRITE: / 'Test run completed. No changes saved.'.
ENDIF.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors AI - AI-Assisted Goal Creation (Set up and hints)
entry.content:
Hello @jenny_geipel ,

We are currently piloting AI-Assisted Goal Writing in SuccessFactors Performance & Goals, and we are seeing consistent behavior where the AI generates content for fields such as goal description / success criteria, but does not populate the Goal Name field.

Here are the details:

  • AI-Assisted Goal Writing is enabled in Provisioning and Admin Center

  • The feature works correctly for other goal fields

  • The Goal Name field remains blank after running AI

 

My questions:

  1. Is this behavior by design — meaning AI will skip the Goal Name field ?

  2. Is there any fallback logic planned (e.g., deriving the goal name from the generated description)?

  3. Is this documented as expected behavior, or should customers expect Goal Name to be generated by default in the future?

This seems to be a common point of confusion for admins, since the Goal Name is arguably one of the most important field during goal creation.

Any official confirmation or documentation pointers would be appreciated.

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Automatically splitting items in a PI document when t...
entry.content:
Hello @Nihit 

Thank you for your question.

In public cloud, embedded EWM, the system restricts inventory document to a maximum of 999 item. See https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/c4d063c8a0874231bf75a5b4c83ddddc.html for more information.

That means when your annual physical inventory selection produces more than 999 HUs, then you must create the PI documents and use a method that helps you enforce splitting. See https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/e54b33636b9a4a96984d8d1e9b98f92a.html for further insights.

You can use the app Schedule the Creations of Physical Inventory Documents and set the Maximum number of items to any value below 999. This will help you create multiple PI documents automatically for the same selection. After that, you can execute Count Physical Inventory for each document you create.

You can achieve it through the delivered scheduling and mass processing settings; it is not a backend table correction in public cloud.

Here is a quick guide 

Step 1: Open Schedule the Creation of Physical Inventory Document, enter your warehouse and any relevant selection (procedure AS or AL, physical inventory area and activity area as your process may require), maintain maximum numbers of items and schedule the job run to immediately or your desired time.

Step 2: Then open Create Physical Inventory Document, then filter by the same warehouse and same selection criteria and confirm that you now have multiple PI documents, each not having more than 999 items.

Step 3: Open Count Physical Inventory, select one of the split PI documents and perform counting and posting as per your process.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Error during saving simulation to the server
entry.content:
Hi there,

In Manager, it is possible to select an object that an author has editing control of and cancel that editing control.  This allows another author to then take editing control of the content objects.  I suspect that someone else with Admin permissions has cancelled editing control of a content object that you are trying to synchronize back to Manager.  Unfortunately, that means that your changes will be lost.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: How GenAI Is Changing SAP Application Development on SAP BTP
entry.content:
Generative AI is rapidly becoming a core enabler in enterprise application development, and SAP Business Technology Platform plays a key role in making this adoption practical and scalable. From accelerating development to improving user experience, GenAI is reshaping how SAP solutions are designed and delivered.

SAP BTP provides a flexible foundation where GenAI services can be embedded into existing SAP landscapes without disrupting core systems. By leveraging SAP BTP, organizations can keep their core clean while innovating at the edge using AI-driven capabilities.

One of the most common use cases of GenAI on SAP BTP is intelligent application development. Developers can use AI-assisted tools to generate code snippets, improve logic quality, and reduce development time. This is especially useful in extension scenarios where custom logic is required without modifying the core S/4HANA system.

Another major area is business automation and decision support. GenAI can analyze large volumes of transactional and unstructured data, generate insights, and assist business users with natural language queries. This reduces dependency on technical teams and improves operational efficiency.

GenAI also enhances user experience through conversational interfaces. Chatbots and virtual assistants built on SAP BTP can interact with SAP applications in natural language, helping users retrieve information, complete tasks, and resolve issues faster.

Security and governance remain critical, and SAP BTP addresses this by offering enterprise-grade controls, role-based access, and compliance-ready AI services. This ensures organizations can adopt GenAI responsibly while protecting sensitive business data.

To get started, organizations should identify high-impact use cases such as reporting, automation, or application extensions. Starting small with pilot projects on SAP BTP allows teams to measure value quickly and scale GenAI initiatives with confidence.

In conclusion, GenAI on SAP BTP is not about replacing developers or business users, but empowering them. With the right strategy and platform, enterprises can unlock faster innovation, better decision-making, and more intelligent SAP applications.

entry.title: How SAP S/4HANA Migration Is Shifting from IT Projects to Business Transformation
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP S/4HANA migration is no longer just about moving from ECC to a new system. Organizations that treat it as an IT-only initiative often face cost overruns, data issues, and poor user adoption. Successful programs recognize S/4HANA as a foundation for long-term business agility.

Why S/4HANA Migration Is More Than a Technical Upgrade

Modern enterprises operate in complex ecosystems where SAP is deeply integrated with finance, procurement, logistics, analytics, and external applications. Any change to SAP impacts:

  • End-to-end business processes

  • Reporting and compliance

  • Data governance and master data quality

  • User experience and productivity

Ignoring these factors increases risk and delays value realization.

Key Business Areas Impacted

  1. Finance & Controlling
    Universal Journal (ACDOCA) simplifies reporting but requires process redesign and data cleanup.

  2. Data Quality & Governance
    Poor master data (vendors, customers, materials) creates migration issues and post-go-live disruptions.

  3. Process Standardization
    S/4HANA encourages clean core and best practices, pushing organizations to reduce custom code and manual workarounds.

  4. Change Management & Adoption
    Fiori UX changes how users interact with SAP, making training and communication critical.

Choosing the Right Migration Approach

There is no one-size-fits-all strategy. Organizations must evaluate:

  • Greenfield vs Brownfield vs Selective Data Transition

  • Business readiness and technical debt

  • Timeline, budget, and risk appetite

Early assessment and stakeholder alignment are key to making the right choice.

Conclusion

A successful SAP S/4HANA migration is a business-led transformation supported by technology—not the other way around. Companies that invest in data quality, process clarity, and change management unlock faster ROI and long-term resilience.

entry.title: SAP ECC to S/4HANA Migration: Lessons Learned, Pitfalls, and Proven Best Practices
entry.content: Paragraph 1 – Introduction With SAP ECC support nearing its end, organizations across industries are accelerating their transition to SAP S/4HANA. While the benefits—real-time analytics, simplified data models, and modern user experience—are compelling, many migration programs struggle due to poor planning, underestimated complexity, and lack of business alignment. This article shares practical insights to help teams avoid common mistakes and migrate with confidence. Paragraph 2 – Key Challenges in ECC to S/4HANA Migration Some of the most frequently encountered challenges include: Data Complexity: Inconsistent, redundant, and legacy data complicates migration. Custom Code Adaptation: ECC custom developments often require remediation or redesign. Integration Issues: Legacy interfaces may not align with S/4HANA APIs and protocols. Skills Gap: Limited hands-on S/4HANA and SAP Fiori expertise within teams. Change Management: User resistance due to new processes and Fiori-based UX. Paragraph 3 – Common Pitfalls to Avoid Treating migration as a purely technical exercise Skipping data cleansing and simplification Underestimating testing effort (especially regression testing) Late involvement of business users Inadequate cutover and go-live planning These pitfalls often lead to delays, cost overruns, and post-go-live instability. Paragraph 4 – Best Practices for a Successful Migration Based on real-world projects, the following practices consistently deliver better outcomes: Start with early system assessment using SAP Readiness Check Clean up custom code using SPAU/SPAU_ENH and ABAP Test Cockpit Invest in data governance and archiving before migration Adopt SAP Activate methodology Prioritize end-user training and change management Perform multiple mock cutovers and production simulations Paragraph 5 – Business Value Beyond Migration Organizations that approach S/4HANA strategically unlock value beyond compliance: Faster financial close Real-time operational insights Improved user productivity with SAP Fiori Strong foundation for AI, automation, and SAP BTP innovations Paragraph 6 – Conclusion A successful SAP ECC to S/4HANA migration requires more than tools—it demands clear strategy, experienced execution, and strong collaboration between IT and business teams. By learning from past challenges and applying proven best practices, organizations can turn migration into a true digital transformation.

entry.title: “GOS Attachments in S/4HANA: What Changed, Where the Data Really Lives, and What You Should Not Do”
entry.content:
Introduction

Generic Object Services (GOS) attachments are widely used across SAP modules to store documents such as PDFs, images, and URLs linked to business objects (POs, PM orders, inspection lots, vendors, etc.).

In ECC, many consultants relied on technical tables like SRGBTBREL, SOOD, and SOFFCONT1 to analyze, report on, or migrate attachment data.
However, in S/4HANA, this approach often leads to confusion, incorrect assumptions, and even migration or performance issues.

This blog consolidates real project observations and clarifies:

  • Where GOS attachments are actually stored

  • Why SRGBTBREL behaves differently in S/4HANA

  • What not to do during reporting or migration

  • Recommended, SAP‑supported approaches

1️⃣ What Is SRGBTBREL – and What It Is Not

SRGBTBREL is part of the GOS relationship framework.
Its purpose is only to store the relationship between:

  • A SAP business object (BOR object + key)

  • And a linked document, note, or URL

⚠️ Important:
SRGBTBREL never stores the attachment itself. It only stores references.

In ECC, this table was commonly populated and therefore widely (mis)used for reporting.

2️⃣ Where Is the Actual Attachment Stored?

If no content server (ArchiveLink) is configured, GOS attachments are stored in SAPoffice.

Purpose Table
Business object ↔ attachment linkSRGBTBREL
Document headerSOOD
File metadata (size, type)SOFM
Actual binary contentSOFFCONT1

🔴 SOFFCONT1 is the critical table.
It stores the RAW binary data and is the main reason for:

  • Database growth

  • DMO memory spikes

  • Migration runtime issues

3️⃣ Why SRGBTBREL Is Often Empty in S/4HANA

Many customers notice this behavior:

  • Attachments exist and are visible in the UI

  • ARCHIV_GET_CONNECTIONS returns data

  • SRGBTBREL remains empty

This is expected behavior in S/4HANA.

SAP has redesigned the attachment framework:

  • Attachments are handled via KPro / ArchiveLink

  • Access is via APIs and services

  • Direct persistence in SRGBTBREL is no longer guaranteed

📌 Key takeaway:
In S/4HANA, do not rely on SRGBTBREL being populated, even if attachments exist.

4️⃣ Reporting on Attachments: Common Mistakes

❌ Wrong approaches

  • Selecting directly from SRGBTBREL for business reporting

  • Using SOFFCONT1 in CDS views

  • Trying to decode binary content in CDS or Datasphere

  • Expecting URLs attached via GOS to be stored as readable text

Even GOS “URL” attachments are stored as binary SAPoffice content, not plain text.

5️⃣ CDS Views & Datasphere: Hard Limitation

You cannot:

  • Call function modules in CDS

  • Convert binary → text inside CDS

  • Reliably extract GOS attachments for Datasphere reporting

If your business requires URLs or attachment references in analytics:
👉 Store URLs as application data, not as GOS attachments.

This is a design limitation, not a missing join or function.

6️⃣ Migration to S/4HANA: Critical Warning ⚠️

Many ECC → S/4HANA projects fail or struggle due to SOFFCONT1.

Typical issues:

  • Huge SOFFCONT1 table never analyzed

  • Orphaned attachments (broken SRGBTBREL links)

  • Massive memory usage during SUM / DMO

  • R3load failures on SOFFCONT1 inserts

📌 Best practices before migration

  • Measure SOFFCONT1 size and growth

  • Analyze attachment relevance

  • Clean up orphaned links

  • Decide what must migrate vs archive

  • Avoid “migrate everything blindly”

7️⃣ What SAP Recommends Instead

✔️ Use GOS / ArchiveLink APIs
✔️ Use ARCHIV_GET_CONNECTIONS and standard services
✔️ Use application logic, not direct table access
✔️ Configure a content server to avoid DB growth
✔️ Keep attachments out of analytical reporting

Conclusion

GOS attachments are technical objects, not business data.

What worked in ECC:

  • Direct table reads

  • SRGBTBREL‑based logic

  • SAPoffice assumptions

👉 Does not scale or hold in S/4HANA.

Understanding where attachments live, how they are linked, and how SAP intends them to be accessed can save:

  • Migration failures

  • Performance issues

  • Unsupported designs

  • Costly rework post go‑live

If you’re working on S/4HANA migration, cleanup, or reporting, treat GOS attachments as a separate technical domain, not just another table to select from.

entry.title: Understanding SAP Attachments: GOS vs ArchiveLink vs KPro Explained Simply
entry.content:
Introduction

Attachments are a common requirement in SAP systems, whether for invoices, deliveries, equipment, or master data. However, SAP does not store all attachments in the same way. Depending on the scenario, attachments may be handled using GOS, ArchiveLink, or KPro, which often leads to confusion during reporting, cleanup, migrations, or troubleshooting.

This blog explains the differences between these attachment mechanisms in a simple and practical way.

1. GOS (Generic Object Services)

GOS is the framework that allows users to attach documents directly from the SAP GUI using the “Services for Object” button.

Key characteristics:

  • Used for standard PC document attachments

  • Supports notes, URLs, and attachments

  • Links business objects to documents

Important technical details:

  • Linkage table: SRGBTBREL

  • Business object information stored using BOR object types

  • Attachments may still be stored in KPro or SAP Office storage

Typical use cases:

  • Manual attachment of PDFs or images to documents

  • Attachments visible directly in SAP GUI transactions

2. ArchiveLink

ArchiveLink is designed for storing large or long‑term documents outside the SAP database, usually on a content server.

Key characteristics:

  • Stores documents externally

  • Optimized for performance and database size reduction

  • Often used for invoices, delivery notes, and print lists

Important technical details:

  • Link tables: TOA01, TOA02

  • Content stored in Content Server repositories

  • Configuration maintained in OAC0 and related transactions

Typical use cases:

  • Invoice attachments

  • Output documents generated by SAP

  • Long‑term document retention

3. KPro (Knowledge Provider)

KPro is the underlying technical framework used by both GOS and ArchiveLink to manage document storage.

Key characteristics:

  • Manages logical and physical document storage

  • Supports database storage and content server storage

  • Enables document lifecycle management

Important technical tables:

  • SOFFLOIO (Logical objects)

  • SOFFPHIO (Physical objects)

KPro explains why deleting an attachment link does not always delete the physical file.

4. Common Confusion Areas

Some frequent misunderstandings include:

  • Deleting a GOS attachment removes only the link, not the physical file

  • TOA01 entries without SRGBTBREL indicate ArchiveLink, not GOS

  • Direct table inserts do not guarantee attachment visibility

  • Different storage types can exist for the same business object

Understanding which framework is used is essential before developing reports or cleanup programs.

5. Practical Recommendations

  • Use SAP APIs instead of direct table updates

  • Always identify whether the attachment is GOS or ArchiveLink

  • Use KPro reorganization tools for cleanup

  • Test cleanup and migration activities in non‑production systems

Conclusion

SAP attachment handling is powerful but complex due to multiple frameworks working together. By understanding the roles of GOS, ArchiveLink, and KPro, SAP professionals can avoid common pitfalls, build reliable reports, and design cleaner solutions.

This knowledge is especially important during system migrations, performance optimization, and data housekeeping activities.

entry.title: Why GOS Attachments Increase HANA Costs in S4HANA and How to Fix It
entry.content:
In many ECC and S4HANA systems, GOS attachments are one of the most overlooked sources of data growth. Although users may delete attachments from transactions like ME23N or FB03, the physical files often remain stored in the backend.

This creates two major problems.
First, HANA database and content server size keeps growing.
Second, migration and system performance are negatively impacted.

Where GOS attachments are stored
GOS attachments are linked to business objects, not directly to transactions. For example, ME23N, ME22N, and ME21N all work on the Purchase Order business object BUS2012.

The attachment relationship is stored in table SRGBTBREL.
The actual file is stored in content repositories using KPro objects such as SOFFLOIO and SOFFPHIO or in SOFFCONT1 depending on configuration.

Why deleting from GOS is not enough
When a user deletes an attachment from GOS, SAP usually removes only the link in SRGBTBREL. The physical file remains in the content server. Over time, this results in thousands of orphaned files that are no longer visible to users but still consume storage.

Why this matters for S4HANA
During S4HANA conversion, all this data is technically still active. Large attachment tables increase migration runtime, system size, and HANA memory costs. Many customers discover attachment tables among the top space consumers only after migration.

How to clean up safely
Standard report RSBCS_REORG works only for specific attachment types and does not handle KPro based GOS data. For proper cleanup, SAP provides KPro reorganization tools such as RSKPRO_REORG and ArchiveLink reorganization transactions.

Before deleting anything, it is critical to analyze which files are truly orphaned and ensure business compliance. Cleanup should always be tested in a quality system first.

Conclusion
GOS attachments are often invisible but expensive. Proactively analyzing and cleaning orphaned attachments can significantly reduce HANA footprint and lower migration risk. Addressing this early in an S4HANA project avoids costly surprises later.

entry.title: Understanding SOFFCONT1 Bloat and How to Safely Reduce HANA Database Size
entry.content:
Many SAP ECC and S 4HANA systems face unexpected database growth, and in most cases SOFFCONT1 appears among the top tables in DB02 or DBACOCKPIT. This table stores binary content such as attachments from SAPoffice, GOS, workflows, and emails. Over the years, SOFFCONT1 can grow to hundreds of GBs or even multiple TBs.

This growth is often invisible to functional teams because attachments continue to work normally. The problem becomes critical during HANA migrations, system copies, or upgrades when memory errors and long runtimes start appearing.

Why SOFFCONT1 Grows So Much

SOFFCONT1 stores raw binary content. It grows mainly because of
Workflow emails and notifications
GOS attachments in business transactions
Old SAPoffice documents that are no longer needed
Deleted business objects where only the link was removed but content remained

In many systems, links in SRGBTBREL or SAPoffice folders are deleted, but the actual binary content stays behind. This creates orphaned data that consumes HANA memory without business value.

Business Impact of SOFFCONT1 Bloat

Large SOFFCONT1 tables cause
Higher HANA licensing costs
Longer backup and restore times
SYSTEM NO ROLL and memory dump errors
Slow exports during system copy or migration
Cutover risks during S 4HANA conversion

These issues are often discovered very late, sometimes just weeks before go live.

Why Standard Cleanup Is Not Enough

Reports like RSBCS REORG help clean SAPoffice documents, but they do not cover all attachment scenarios.
GOS attachments stored via KPro or Content Server are not fully handled.
Broken links in SRGBTBREL are not automatically resolved.
RSBCS REORG works slowly on very large datasets and may run for days.

As a result, many customers run cleanup programs but see little to no reduction in table size.

Safe Approach to SOFFCONT1 Reduction

A safe cleanup strategy should include
Identifying active versus orphaned content
Validating links between business objects and attachments
Ensuring no productive document is deleted
Reducing table size without system downtime

This requires content level analysis rather than only table level deletion.

Recommended Cleanup Strategy

Step one is to analyze SOFFCONT1 volume by attachment type and age.
Step two is to validate SRGBTBREL links to detect broken or unused references.
Step three is to separate business critical attachments from obsolete ones.
Step four is to remove only verified orphaned content.

This approach avoids data loss and audit issues while still delivering measurable HANA size reduction.

Typical Results

In real systems, customers usually achieve
Thirty to seventy percent reduction in SOFFCONT1 size
Significant HANA memory savings
Faster migrations and system copies
Lower operational risk during upgrades

Most importantly, the cleanup becomes defensible for audit and compliance teams.

Conclusion

SOFFCONT1 growth is not just a technical issue. It directly impacts cost, performance, and migration success. Treating it as a content engineering problem instead of a simple deletion task is the key to safe and effective cleanup.

Early analysis and controlled reduction can turn hidden technical debt into measurable business value.

entry.title: Accelerating S/4HANA Success: Why Technical Excellence Alone Is Not Enough
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP S/4HANA transformations are among the most significant initiatives organizations undertake. They involve not only a technical upgrade, but also fundamental changes to business processes, roles, and ways of working.

Yet, despite strong technical execution, many S/4HANA projects fail to deliver expected business value. The reason is often simple: users are not ready.

The Hidden Risk in S/4HANA Programs

Most S/4HANA programs focus heavily on:

  • System conversion or implementation

  • Functional configuration

  • Data migration and testing

  • Go‑live readiness from a technical perspective

What is frequently underestimated is the human side of transformation:

  • Are users aware of what is changing?

  • Do managers understand their role during the transition?

  • Are business teams prepared to adopt new processes on Day 1?

Without addressing these questions, even a technically flawless system can struggle after go‑live.

Why Change Management Matters

Organizational Change Management (OCM) plays a critical role in ensuring S/4HANA success by focusing on:

  • Stakeholder alignment across business and IT

  • Clear, role‑based communication

  • Training aligned with real business scenarios

  • Proactive resistance management

  • Leadership engagement and accountability

When change management is integrated early—rather than added late—it significantly improves adoption and long‑term value realization.

Lessons Learned from Real S/4HANA Programs

Across multiple S/4HANA initiatives, a few consistent lessons emerge:

  • Late involvement of business users increases resistance

  • Generic training does not support real‑world usage

  • Communication overload creates confusion instead of clarity

  • Adoption issues often appear after go‑live, not before

Successful programs treat change management as a core workstream, not a support activity.

A Practical Way Forward

To improve outcomes, SAP customers and partners should:

  • Embed change management from project initiation

  • Align communication with project milestones

  • Train users based on business impact, not system features

  • Measure adoption—not just technical readiness

S/4HANA success is not defined at go‑live. It is defined by how effectively the business adopts and uses the solution afterward.

Conclusion

SAP S/4HANA transformations are as much about people as they are about technology. Organizations that recognize this early—and act on it—are far more likely to achieve sustainable results.

If you are planning or executing an S/4HANA program, investing in structured change management can be the difference between a system that works and a transformation that delivers value.

entry.title: S/4HANA Migration Risk You Shouldn’t Ignore: SOFFCONT1 & Attachment Integrity
entry.content:
Many SAP ECC and S/4HANA systems carry years of unmanaged attachment data. Tables like SOFFCONT1 and relationships in SRGBTBREL grow silently and become a serious risk during S/4HANA migration.

Common issues seen during cutover:

  • SOFFCONT1 becoming one of the largest HANA tables

  • SYSTEM_NO_ROLL or memory dumps during migration

  • Missing GOS attachments after BP conversion

  • Broken ArchiveLink references post go‑live

These problems usually surface late—during testing or even after production go‑live—making remediation expensive and risky.

Best practices before migration:

  • Analyze SOFFCONT1 growth and attachment volume early

  • Validate SRGBTBREL and GOS relationships

  • Check ArchiveLink repository consistency

  • Perform read‑only integrity checks before remediation

Addressing attachment integrity upfront helps:

  • Reduce HANA database size

  • Avoid cutover surprises

  • Ensure business-critical documents remain accessible

Attachment data may look “technical,” but its impact is very real for finance, compliance, and operations

entry.title: Understanding GOS Attachments in SAP: Tables, Storage, and Reporting Explained
entry.content:
Introduction

Generic Object Services (GOS) allow users to attach documents to SAP business objects such as Purchase Orders, Accounting Documents, and Materials. While attaching files is easy, identifying, reporting, and migrating these attachments is often confusing.

This blog explains how GOS attachments work technically and how consultants can report and manage them efficiently.

1. What Are GOS Attachments?

GOS attachments are files linked to SAP business objects using relationships rather than direct table storage. These attachments can be stored in:

  • SAP database (SOFFCONT1)

  • SAP Content Server

  • External repositories (OpenText, ArchiveLink)

2. Key Tables for GOS Attachments

Table Purpose
SRGBTBRELMain relationship table for GOS attachments
SOOD / SOFMSAPoffice document metadata
SOFFCONT1Attachment content stored in DB
DRADUsed only for DMS, not GOS

👉 RELTYPE = 'ATTA' indicates an attachment relationship.

3. How Object Keys (INSTID_A) Are Derived

The field INSTID_A stores the object key, for example:

  • FI Document → Company Code + Doc Number + Fiscal Year

  • PO → Purchase Order Number

  • Material → Material Number

Transactions like FB03 or ME23N do not store attachments—they only display them.

4. GOS vs DMS vs ArchiveLink

Feature GOS DMS ArchiveLink
StorageDB / Content ServerContent ServerContent Server
MetadataMinimalRichArchive-based
ReportingCustomStandard reportsStandard tools

5. Reporting Best Practices

  • Build custom ABAP reports or CDS views on SRGBTBREL

  • Join with object master tables (BKPF, EKKO, MARA)

  • Add attachment indicator (Yes/No)

  • Avoid transaction-based logic

Conclusion

Understanding how GOS attachments are stored and linked helps in reporting, migration, and S/4HANA readiness. A clear distinction between GOS, DMS, and ArchiveLink is essential for clean system design.

entry.title: Understanding GOS Attachments in SAP: Tables, Storage, and Reporting Best Practices
entry.content:
1. Introduction

Attachments are commonly used in SAP to store invoices, contracts, screenshots, and other supporting documents. Most of these are handled through Generic Object Services (GOS). However, many consultants struggle to identify where these attachments are stored and how to report on them.

This blog focuses on the technical understanding of GOS attachments from an ABAP and Basis perspective.

2. What Are GOS Attachments?

GOS allows users to attach documents to SAP business objects such as:

  • Accounting Documents (FB03)

  • Purchase Orders (ME23N)

  • Sales Orders (VA03)

  • Material Masters (MM03)

⚠️ Important:
Transactions like FB03 or ME23N do NOT store attachments. They only display business objects.

3. Key Table for GOS Attachments – SRGBTBREL

The main table used to identify GOS attachments is:

SRGBTBREL

Important fields:

  • TYPEID_A → Business Object Type (e.g. BKPF, BUS2012)

  • INSTID_A → Object Key (Document number, PO number, etc.)

  • RELTYPE = 'ATTA' → Confirms attachment relationship

If a record exists with RELTYPE = ATTA, the object has attachments.

4. Where Is the Actual File Stored?

SRGBTBREL only stores the relationship, not the file itself.

Depending on configuration, files are stored in:

  • SOFFCONT1 → SAP Database

  • Content Server

  • OpenText

  • ArchiveLink

This depends on OAC0 / OAC3 configuration.

5. How to Identify Attachments for Different Modules

Examples:

  • FI Document → Company Code + Document Number + Fiscal Year

  • Purchase Order → EBELN

  • Material → MATNR

These values form the INSTID_A.

6. Reporting Strategy (Yes/No Attachments)

There is no standard SAP report for cross-object GOS attachment reporting.

Best approach:

  • Custom ABAP Report or CDS View

  • Start from SRGBTBREL

  • Join with application tables (BKPF, EKKO, MARA)

  • Display:

    • Object Number

    • Object Type

    • Attachment Available (Yes/No)

7. GOS vs DMS vs ArchiveLink

Feature GOS DMS ArchiveLink
User-friendly✅❌❌
Structured documents❌✅❌
Long-term archiving❌❌✅

8. Conclusion

Understanding how GOS attachments work internally helps greatly with:

  • Audits

  • Reporting

  • System migration (ECC → S/4HANA)

  • Storage optimization

Hope this blog helps SAP consultants facing similar challenges.
Feel free to comment or share your experience!

entry.title: Understanding GOS Attachments in SAP: Tables, Objects, and Best Practices
entry.content:
Generic Object Services (GOS) play a key role in SAP by allowing users to attach documents, notes, and links to business objects such as Purchase Orders, Accounting Documents, and Material Masters.
However, when it comes to reporting, auditing, or mass analysis of attachments, many SAP consultants struggle to identify where and how these attachments are stored.

This blog provides a practical overview of GOS attachments, commonly used tables, and real-world scenarios. 

What Are GOS Attachments?

GOS (Generic Object Services) allow users to:

  • Attach files (PDF, Excel, etc.)

  • Add notes

  • Create external links

These services are available via the “Services for Object” button in SAP GUI transactions like:

  • ME23N (Purchase Order)

  • FB03 (Accounting Document)

  • MM03 (Material Master)

Key Tables Used for GOS Attachments

1. SRGBTBREL – GOS Relationship Table

This is the most important table for GOS attachments.

Common Fields:

  • RELTYPE → ATTA (Attachment), NOTE (Notes)

  • TYPEID_A → Business Object Type (e.g. BUS2012, BKPF, BUS1001)

  • INSTID_A → Object key (document number, material number, etc.)

Example Use Cases:

  • Purchase Order attachments → TYPEID_A = BUS2012

  • Accounting document attachments → TYPEID_A = BKPF

  • Material attachments → TYPEID_A = BUS1001

2. TOA01 – ArchiveLink Attachments

Used when documents are stored via ArchiveLink or a content server.

  • SAP_OBJECT → Object type (e.g. BKPF)

  • OBJECT_ID → Concatenated key (BUKRS + BELNR + GJAHR)

3. DRAD – DMS Attachments

If your system uses Document Management System (DMS):

  • Material attachments are often linked here

  • OBJECT_KEY contains the Material Number

Common Reporting Scenarios

✔ Find documents with or without attachments

Join:

  • BKPF (or business table)

  • SRGBTBREL using object key
    If no entry exists → no attachment

✔ Count attachments per business object

Group by:

  • TYPEID_A

  • INSTID_A

This is useful for audits and compliance checks.

Important Notes

  • There is no direct link between T-code and attachments

  • Attachments are linked to Business Objects, not transactions

  • One Business Object can be used by multiple transactions

Conclusion

Understanding how GOS attachments are stored helps SAP consultants:

  • Build audit reports

  • Identify missing documents

  • Support migrations to SharePoint or other content servers

Knowing tables like SRGBTBREL, TOA01, and DRAD can save hours of analysis and troubleshooting.

entry.title: Fixing SOFFCONT1 Bloat & Broken Attachments in SAP Using Python (No ABAP, No Downtime)
entry.content:
Introduction

Large SAP systems often struggle with SOFFCONT1 table bloat, broken SRGBTBREL links, and failing GOS / ArchiveLink attachments, especially after system copies, Unicode conversions, or S/4HANA migrations.
These issues increase HANA memory costs and create functional problems for business users.

Common SAP Attachment Problems

Many SAP Basis and functional teams report:

  • SOFFCONT1 in top‑5 tables in DB02

  • SYSTEM_NO_ROLL errors during exports

  • 2–10 TB of binary data inside HANA

  • Missing GOS attachments after BP conversion

  • ArchiveLink repositories not connecting post‑migration

These problems are usually data integrity issues, not application bugs.

Why ABAP‑Only Fixes Are Not Enough

Traditional ABAP cleanup programs:

  • Run slowly on TB‑scale data

  • Consume dialog/background resources

  • Require transports and system changes

  • Are risky on production systems

For large landscapes, a different approach is needed.

Python‑Powered Integrity Engineering for SAP

A Python‑based external processing model allows SAP teams to:

  • Analyze SOFFCONT1, SRGBTBREL, and metadata safely

  • Validate attachment pointers and repository consistency

  • Identify orphaned or duplicated binaries

  • Process TB‑scale data without ABAP changes

  • Run with zero downtime

This approach works across ECC, S/4HANA, and RISE environments.

Typical Results Observed

Projects using this method commonly achieve:

  • 30–70% reduction in SOFFCONT1 size

  • Significant HANA cost avoidance

  • Restored GOS and ArchiveLink visibility

  • Cleaner migrations and exports

When Should You Act?

Consider an integrity check if:

  • SOFFCONT1 keeps growing every month

  • Attachments disappear after migration

  • Export/import jobs fail due to memory or roll errors

  • HANA costs are increasing without business growth

Conclusion

Attachment integrity is no longer just a housekeeping task—it directly impacts system stability, migration success, and HANA costs.
Modern SAP landscapes benefit greatly from external, Python‑based data engineering alongside traditional SAP tools.

entry.title: Re: Deletion of CI_COBL
entry.content:
CI_COBL ZZ* Field Removal (Tested)

We added a ZZ* field to CI_COBL in the customer system for a requirement. Later we realized it was not needed and wanted to remove it. After reading SAP Note 3456968, I thought it should not be deleted. But I tested it in a DEMO system and successfully removed it.

Steps:
1) Check all tables where the ZZ* field is used and make sure there are no values stored. If there are values, clear them first.
2) In SE11, select CI_COBL and click Delete.
3) If CDS activation errors occur (CDS_DS_CCS_PAR, V_COEP_V2_4):
- Activate CDS_DS_CCS_PAR in ADT (Eclipse).
- Run FCO_CDS_VIEW_GENERATE again and use IV_RESET (via debug) to regenerate the views so the ZZ* field is removed.
4) Finally, to resolve the NSDM_E_MSEG error, I deleted the Extend View object (ZCI_MSEG_E) that I had created.
5) Check key objects/tables (ACDOCA, BSEG, V_COEP, MATDOC, MSEG). No errors occurred.

Result:
This worked in the DEMO system, and I plan to apply the same steps in the customer development system.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602亮点前瞻：跨技术话题（Cross Technology Topic）
entry.content:
又到了半年一度版本升级的日子。在这篇文章里，我会介绍一些在2602版本中跨技术话题中值得分享的一些亮点：

 

目录

一、数据迁移

  1. 新应用：Explore Migration Objects
  2. 2602版本中迁移对象的变化

二、用户体验

  1. /n /o重出江湖
  2. 下载和上载空间
  3. Launchpad的新布局

三、其他亮点

  1. 视图浏览器：图形化展示CDS之间的关系
  2. 权限的更大灵活性：直接给业务角色分配IAM应用

 

 

一、数据迁移

1. 新应用：Explore Migration Objects

         在Cloud ERP数据迁移领域，现在已经有超过200个迁移对象。虽然我们能够在每个迁移对象的说明文档中查到该迁移对象是否有前序依赖的对象，但在如此多的迁移对象的情况下，我们一直缺少一个可视化的界面，能够让我们在项目实施过程中更快速地看到迁移对象之间的依赖关系。

         现在我们推出了一个全新的应用：Explore Migration Objects。通过该应用，我们通过图形化的方式显示某个特定的迁移对象有哪些前序依赖的迁移对象。如下图所示，如果我们想要导入“产品-按新组织级别扩展现有记录”，它的必要的前序对象会用橙色的实线显示，我们必须先导入迁移对象“产品”。它的可选的前序对象会用灰色的虚线显示，“利润中心”和“生产供应区”是它的两个非必要的前序对象。

         这个应用可以帮助我们在项目阶段更方便和准确地确定迁移范围。同时，在图形界面上，你也可以点击依赖的迁移对象，扩展显示与它相关的迁移对象。图形界面可以随意扩展。

 

除了按照迁移对象查找，这个应用也支持按照范围项目（Scope Item）查找。可以查找某个范围项目下有哪些相关的迁移对象。比如下图举例，我想查找范围项目BMD（采购合同）牵涉到哪些迁移对象，我也可以找出这个信息，用图形化的方式显示：

 

 

最后，说明一下体验该应用需要分配业务目录Data Migration – Cockpit（SAP_CA_BC_MIG_PC）。

 

2. 2602版本中迁移对象的变化

关于2602版本中迁移对象的变化，比如新增的对象、更改的对象、删除的对象等，该信息已经发布在SAP Help Portal，具体可通过以下链接查看：

版本 2602 的更改概览 | SAP Help Portal

 

二、用户体验

1. /n /o重出江湖

         几乎所有使用过SAP传统GUI界面的用户都非常熟悉/n和/o这两个指令，/n+tcode就能在当前界面快速打开新的应用。当我需要保留当前界面的同时打开新界面时，输入/o+tcode就能在新界面中打开应用。每一个SAP用户都会熟练操作/n和/o的指令。如今，从2602版本开始，这两个指令又回来了。

         只不过Fiori应用不再是以前的tcode，取而代之的是Fiori ID。比如应用“IAM信息系统”的Fiori ID是F2450。我可以在任何界面的右上角查找框里输入“/nf2450”，就会在当前网页打开应用“IAM信息系统”：

 

 

输入/nf2450后，按回车键：

 

 

同样，上面的这个例子，如果我输入的是/of2450，然后回车，会在一个新的页面打开“IAM信息系统”这个应用。

 

另外，如果你只输入/n，然后回车，会快速回到主页。

如果你只输入/o，然后回车，会在一个新的页面打开主页的界面。

这些操作也是和以前SAP GUI的习惯保持一致的。

 

2. 下载和上载空间

         从这个版本开始，我们可以批量下载和上载空间（Space）了。下载和上载操作也会包含所选空间下面的页面（Page）。这个功能，对于跨系统间的操作，系统之间不能传输的，可以快速地复用我们所设计的空间。

         在“管理快速启动板空间”App上，之前的界面是这样的：

 

这个版本升级之后，会新增“下载”和“上载”两个操作链接：

 

操作的基本流程如下：

  1. 在源系统中，选中一至多个想要下载的空间，点击“下载”。
  2. 会下载一个JSON文件，文件名为Spaces_系统名_日期时间.json。
  3. 打开目标系统，打开管理快速启动板空间。
  4. 点击“上载”，选中之前下载的JSON文件，然后上传。

 

3. Launchpad的新布局

         在上个版本中，我们推出了Launchpad的新布局：增强的导航菜单，在SAP徽标旁边显示产品名称。同时，用户菜单也做了显示优化和顺序调整。

         新界面下左上角的导航菜单：

 

新界面下右上角的用户菜单：

 

从这个版本开始，新布局将成为默认现实。因此，强烈建议在“激活功能”中，激活下面的选项以开启Launchpad的新布局：

/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE

 

三、其他亮点

1. 视图浏览器：图形化展示CDS之间的关系

         应用“视图浏览器”（View Browser）一直是我们客户最常用的应用之一，所有与CDS视图相关的操作如自定义接口、报表等操作都绕不开使用这个应用。在2602版本中，视图浏览器首次新增了图形化展示CDS视图依赖关系的功能。图形的方式能更直观、更方便地给我们的客户展示CDS视图（包括表）之间的关系，相信这个功能能提升大家对这个应用的使用体验。

         例如，在视图浏览器中，当我输入I_SalesOrder并选中，页签中增加了“相关性图表”这一项：

 

然后，在主界面中，你会看到与I_SalesOrder有直接关系的其他CDS视图以及相关的表：

 

比如，绿色的代表已经发布的CDS视图，灰色的代表尚未发布的CDS视图，蓝色的代表数据库表。对于CDS视图，你还能看到关键用户扩展和云开发扩展各自的发布状态。

你还可以点击右上角的“转置”链接，图形界面可以从垂直展示的方式变成水平展示，如下所示：

 

 

2. 权限的更大灵活性：直接给业务角色分配IAM应用

         在之前的版本中，我们推出了IAM应用程序这个概念，在权限设计上以应用而不是业务目录作为最小单元，给了权限分配极大的灵活性。但是，我们还是需要首先给业务角色分配相应的业务目录，然后在已分配的权限里做调整。

         从这个版本开始，我们甚至可以直接给业务角色分配IAM应用程序，可以不需要分配业务目录。简单来说，之前如果需要分配某个应用的权限，你需要首先找到这个应用相关的业务目录并分配，然后再做调整，把不需要的应用去除。现在，你可以直接给你的业务角色分配想要的应用访问权限。下面，我将通过一个例子来做解释：

         假设我设计了一个数据迁移的业务角色MIGRATION_USER，我给它分配了一个数据迁移的业务目录，你能看到它能访问数据迁移工具相关的应用，如下所示：

 

在IAM应用程序页签下，点击右上角的编辑按钮，你可以看到有一个“添加”按钮：

 

         假设我需要我的这个角色的用户在导入数据之后，可以查看销售订单和采购订单的数据，以验证导入的数据是否正确。我可以点击添加按钮，查找相关的IAM应用并添加如下：

 

         你能看到，我直接添加了“显示销售订单”和“显示采购订单”的权限，分配类型为“直接”，也就是我直接添加的权限，而不是通过业务目录分配而得。有了这种方式，对于我们需要配置非常个性化的业务角色将会更加方便。

 

         以上是关于SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602版本跨技术话题的一些重要分享，希望对你的日常使用有所帮助。如果你有任何问题，欢迎留言或者私信联系！

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602亮点前瞻——AI创新（AI Innovation）
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ERP 2602 版本的发布，继续践行 SAP 的核心承诺：将智能精准嵌入关键业务流程。

2602 版本中进一步强化了嵌入式AI在关键业务流程中的开箱即用能力，显著拓展了Joule在更多业务场景中的自然交互支持。同时，我们也正式开启了新一代代理式AI功能的Beta测试，SAP Cloud ERP 的智能能力进一步演进，呈现出更强的情境感知、任务关联与业务导向性。

本篇博客将为您详解 2602 版本中的关键 AI 创新，并聚焦于其在用户体验、财务、销售、制造与采购等核心业务领域的应用。

关于如何在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中激活SAP Business AI功能，请参看以下SAP note：3651017 - 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 中激活 SAP Business AI 功能 - SAP for Me

 

用户体验与通用功能 (User Experience & Cross Topic)

AI 辅助错误解释 (AI-Assisted Error Explanation) ：

当业务用户在基于 SAP Fiori elements 的应用中遇到错误时，生成式 AI 会自动分析错误代码并提供解释。它不仅能指出根本原因，还会直接给出解决建议，帮助用户快速修正数据，减少维护停机时间。

DEMO https://dam.sap.com/mac/u/a/rzjZtK1?rc=10&doi=SAP1166518

 

“我的主页”智能个性化 (Smart Personalization of My Home)：

 用户可以通过自然语言指令（如“我想跟踪销售订单履行情况”）来搜索并添加应用或见解卡片。AI 会推荐最相关的应用，并在添加前显示应用描述和实时 KPI 预览，大大简化了新用户的个性化配置流程。

Demo：https://dam.sap.com/mac/app/p/video/asset/preview/6Lr5YLQ?ltr=a&rc=10&doi=SAP1224308

 

主数据快速查询 (Joule for Master Data)：

用户可直接通过 Joule 助手查询业务伙伴、客户及供应商的详细属性。帮助用户即时获取所需信息，减少在用户界面中的反复操作。支持查询的范围包括基本资料、角色、地址、行业、销售范围数据、税务信息以及财务方面等数据。

 

财务 (Finance)

审核手册中的AI 辅助业务见解 (AI-assisted Business Insights in Review Booklets)：

继成本中心、集团财务报表、专业服务项目审核手册之后，2602版本中，在公司获利能力（Company Profitability）、产品获利能力（Product Profitability）及信贷额度分析（Credit Line Analysis）审核手册中集成了预定义的 AI 辅助业务见解（也称为“快速操作 Quick Action”），帮助用户快速分析和验证多维数据。

  • 公司获利能力审核手册 (Company Profitability Review Booklet)：

该应用支持销售会计分析一个或多个公司代码的获利能力。通过“业务见解”功能支持并排显示多个公司代码的边际贡献。例如，总结本财年的边际贡献，总结最佳和最差产品组等功能。

  • 产品获利能力审核手册 (Product Profitability Review Booklet)：

该应用主要面向销售会计，用于通过“边际概览”和“销货成本 (COGS) 明细”页面分析产品利润。利用 AI 针对产品获利能力的期间对比 (Period-over-Period) 生成财务业务见解，提供边际增益最高/最低的前5个产品及产品组分析，支持更明智的决策。

  • 信贷额度分析审核手册 (Credit Line Analysis - Review Booklet)：

2602将经典的信贷额度分析功能迁移到了新的审核手册框架中。同时AI 功能可以为手册中的每个页签生成多个 AI 辅助的概览，例如：额度与金额监控，交易排名识别，使用率分析等。

 

会计应计智能代理 (Accounting Accruals Agent)Beta版本：

通过基于会计准则文件、历史数据和计算值建议应计项目，支持财务团队将工作重心从手动准备转变为集中审核。应计提案直接呈现在“管理应计提案”应用中，并附带清晰的推导解释，帮助总账会计在不失去过程控制的情况下，更有信心地过账应计项目。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

 

现金管理智能代理 (Cash Management Agent)Beta版本：

该代理能够通过识别日常银行对账单中的数据，自动发现潜在的资金短缺或盈余，并提供可操作的转账建议和提案，从而提高利息收益并优化现金流。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

有关Beta发布的注册和更多信息，请关注Influence Opportunity Homepage - Customer Influence

 

生产会计 AI 辅助错误解决（AI-Assisted Error Resolution in Production Accounting）：

用户可以通过 Joule 显示基于事件的错误并解释其根本原因。Joule 还能提供文本形式的解决方案，并在存在多种选项时建议最佳方案。

 

销售管理 (Sales)

销售订单自动提取 (Automatic Sales Order Creation) ：

销售代表可以上传 PDF 或图像格式的采购订单，系统自动提取信息并创建销售订单请求，同时根据提取数据建议售达方等字段值。

 

退货订单输入建议（Manage Customer Returns–Version 2）：

在“管理客户退货 (Version 2)”应用中，系统会根据历史模式为常见字段（如后续活动、退款类型）提供建议，置信度超过 70% 的值将被高亮显示。

 

制造（Manufacturing）

生产计划与运营代理 (Production Planning and Operations Agent)Beta版本：

可在“管理生产订单”应用中通过“Joule 发布（Joule Release）”按钮启动。该功能可一次性辅助发布多达 20 个订单。代理会自动执行物料可用性（含替代件检查）、工作中心产能及进度验证。若上述条件不满足，代理还会主动建议重新排程（Rescheduling）工作方案。

Demo Digital Library - Asset Preview Page

有关Beta发布的注册和更多信息，请关注Influence Opportunity Homepage - Customer Influence

 

生产工艺路线建议与工艺路线复制 (AI-assisted Production Routing Proposal and Copy Routing):

该功能支持生产工程师和计划员根据物料名称、描述和物料清单 (BOM) 识别相似的现有工艺路线。用户可以直接接收建议并进行复制和微调，无需从头开始构建，从而减少重复录入并降低数据不一致的风险.

更多详细信息请查看 blog

 

采购(Procurement)

使用 Joule 批量更新交货日期（Mass update of delivery date using Joule）

该功能允许用户通过Joule快速批量更新采购订单的计划行项目交货日期，（例如“将采购订单4711的交货日期更新为2026-1-31”）。Joule会精准识别指令中涉及的订单及计划行，并在后台自动应用更改，极大简化了在供应商报告延迟等场景下的订单调整流程。

 

AI 辅助采购订单审批提醒（AI-assisted purchase order approvals reminder）2603发布

该功能通过Joule的对话式交互，帮助用户快速识别待审批的采购订单并加速审批流程。用户可使用自然语言直接搜索处于等待状态的订单，查询待处理审批人的姓名及联系方式，并自动生成提醒文本，通过集成通信渠道（如Outlook邮件）一键发送提醒，从而显著缩短审批周期，提升采购效率。

 

综上所述，SAP Cloud ERP 2602 版本通过将智能深度嵌入从用户体验到财务、销售、制造、采购等核心业务流程， SAP 正持续通过 “应用、数据、AI”​ 的飞轮效应，赋能企业构建更智能、敏捷与韧性的运营核心。

更多有关SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)2602版本中的发布亮点信息，请关注论坛中的其他Blog.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公有版2026年大中华区Product Expert Training上半年度的产品专家培训系列也将在4-5月拉开序幕，敬请期待。

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602亮点前瞻：供应链管理和质量管理
entry.content:
在本篇博客中，我将会重点展示在 SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602版本当中供应链管理和质量管理板块发布的新增功能，将会覆盖以下话题内容： 

  • 供应链管理：物流跨主题、订单承诺、库存管理、库存分析与控制、仓库管理等
  • 质量管理：质量计划、质量检验、质量改进等

此外，有关运输管理以及更多仓库管理相关内容请查看对应专题博客。

 

供应链管理 

 

（亮点1：）物流跨主题 – 处理单元

在 SAP Cloud ERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition）2602 版本中，物流跨主题板块的处理单元（Handling Unit）相关配置进行了术语标准化优化。针对处理单元使用的 Serial Shipping Container Codes（SSCC） 编码，系统界面和文档中原先的 “ILN 基础号” 已统一更新为 “GS1 公司前缀”，与当前 GS1 国际标准保持一致。这一调整覆盖了按工厂/库存地点及按仓库号维护 SSCC 编码的相关配置活动。

需要说明的是，本次更新仅涉及术语层面优化，系统生成逻辑及现有业务流程保持不变。通过更加清晰、标准化的命名方式，用户在配置和理解 SSCC 结构时更加直观，有助于降低沟通偏差，并提升跨区域、跨组织管理及后续系统扩展和合规管理的可维护性。

 涉及此项更新的配置项如下：

  • SSCUI: 103441 Maintain SSCC Generation for each Plant/Storage Location 针对每个工厂/存储地点维护装运集装箱序列码生成

 

  • SSCUI: 102843 Maintain SSCC Generation for each Warehouse Number 维护每仓库编号的 SSCC 生成

 

 

（亮点2：）物流跨主题 – 序列号管理

在本次版本更新中，序列号管理（Serial Number Management）的配置结构进行了优化。原先的配置活动 “定义序列号配置文件（Define Serial Number Profiles, 103636）” 已从 仓库管理 → 仓库主数据 → 仓库序列号设置 迁移至新的路径 Logistics → Serial Number Management → 常规设置 进行维护。

通过将与序列号管理相关的配置集中到同一节点，系统结构更加清晰统一，客户可以在跨业务场景（如仓库、生产或销售流程）中集中管理序列号策略。这不仅提升了配置的一致性，也增强了整体管理效率，使序列号管理更直观、易维护。

备注：以上截图来自内部测试系统Configure Your Solution - SSCUI路径，若为3SL Landscape，请搜索Configuration Activity: Define Serial Number Profiles 103636的路径。

 

（亮点3：）订单承诺 – 产品可用性显示中的供应保护指示

在 SAP Cloud ERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition）2602 版本中，产品可用性显示（Display Product Availability）应用新增了供应保护（Supply Protection，SUP） 图标，用于直观标识当前显示的可用数量是否受 SUP 配置影响。图标直接显示在产品可用数量旁，当在检查范围（Scope of Check）配置中启用“针对特定凭证类型启用供应保护”，且系统已配置 SUP 时，显示的可用数量可能与销售订单创建时略有差异，因为系统会根据 SUP 规则对优先客户、渠道或业务类型进行保护计算。

SUP 图标在界面上可呈现两种状态：灰色表示可用数量未受到 SUP 影响，蓝色表示可用数量可能已根据 SUP 配置调整。通过这一增强功能，用户可以更透明地理解可用数量的来源与计算逻辑，减少因 SUP 规则产生的疑惑，从而提升 SUP 配置在业务运营中的可解释性与可控性。需要注意的是，SUP 功能属于付费 Scope Item 1JW，需要客户按需购买并激活才能使用。

 

（亮点4：）库存管理 – 预留

在本次版本更新中，预留相关流程得到了进一步增强。用户现在可以在 “管理预留项目（Manage Reservation Items）” 应用中，直接基于预留创建库存转储过账（移动类型 311）。执行转储时，系统会自动跳转至 “管理预留物料凭证（Manage Material Documents for Reservations）” 应用完成过账操作，过账成功后自动生成两条物料凭证明细：一条对应发货（Goods Issue），另一条对应收货（Goods Receipt）。

这一增强使库存转储业务与预留管理更加紧密衔接，减少手动切换和重复录入操作，提升操作效率，同时增强业务流程的可追溯性，为用户提供更流畅的库存管理体验。

 

（亮点5：）库存分析与控制 – 物料凭证概览

在本次版本更新中，库存分析与控制板块的“物料凭证概览（Material Documents Overview）”应用新增了多项显示优化功能，进一步提升物料凭证的可视化和分析能力。应用在本版本中新增提供两种列表视图：平面列表（Flat List）-可显示物料、工厂、库存地点、移动类型、特殊库存类型、数量等关键字段，便于快速浏览核心信息；层次结构清单（Hierarchical List）-则按物料和工厂进行分组，帮助用户直观了解物料在不同工厂的物料凭证分布。同时，本应用也支持数量与价值的汇总显示，方便进行库存与财务分析。

借助这些增强功能，用户不仅可以快速查看物料凭证明细，还能轻松获取所选物料凭证的详细信息，从而显著提升物料凭证管理的效率和数据可读性。

 

（亮点6：）仓库管理 – 精简客户退货流程（包装材料和赠品退回支持）

在本次版本更新中，精简客户退货流程（Lean Customer Returns）新增了对包装材料及随产品附赠免费物品的退货支持。通过这一功能，用户在处理退货时无需进行库存检验，即可将包装材料或免费附赠品直接退回，从而简化操作流程。

具体来说，用户在销售模块中创建精简退货单（Lean Returns Order）后，系统将自动生成退货交货单（Returns Delivery），该交货单在仓库管理中作为入库交货单接收，退回物品可直接入库上架，无需额外质量检验。此功能减少了人工操作环节，提升仓储处理效率，同时确保退回物料能够快速、准确地入库管理。

 

 

 

质量管理

 

（亮点7：）质量计划 – 显示质量信息记录（F2256）继任应用

在本次版本更新中，“显示质量信息记录（Display Quality Info Record in Procurement，F2256）”应用迎来了继任者-“管理质量信息记录（Manage Quality Info Records，F2256A）”。从 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 开始，“管理质量信息记录”将成为“显示质量信息记录”的官方继任应用，未来“显示质量信息记录”将逐步被替代，我们建议用户尽早切换以确保业务连续性。

新应用“管理质量信息记录”在功能上实现了集中管理，用户可在同一应用中显示、创建和修改质量信息记录，无需在多个应用间来回手动切换。同时，“管理质量信息记录”提供了生产部件审批流程（PPAP）相关信息，实现质量管理全流程可视化，并优化了应用内导航选项，提高使用效率。请注意，访问该应用需要用户拥有以下业务目录之一：QM - 检验批（SAP_QM_BC_INSPECTION_LOT_PC）或QM - 采购中的质量管理（SAP_QM_BC_QM_PROCUREMENT_PC）。通过升级至新应用，企业能够更加便捷地管理采购质量信息记录，提升操作效率与质量管理透明度。

 

 

（亮点8：）质量计划 – FMEA 相关应用将被弃用

在 SAP Cloud ERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition）2602 版本中，与失效模式与影响分析（FMEA）相关的以下应用已被弃用，并将在后续版本中从 SAP Fiori Launchpad 中删除，具体包括：管理 FMEA（Manage FMEAs）、FMEA 驾驶舱（FMEA Cockpit）、FMEA 监控（FMEA Monitor）以及 FMEA 显示（Display FMEA）。

FMEA 是一种用于识别潜在失效模式、评估其影响及发生概率，并制定预防措施的系统化方法，帮助客户在产品和流程设计阶段降低风险、提高可靠性，但相应的系统使用也需要管理的跟进与投入。本版本开始FMEA相关应用将被弃用，且目前这些应用没有继任版本，客户需要提前规划业务使用和替代方案，以避免因应用移除带来的潜在影响。建议相关团队评估现有 FMEA 流程，并制定相应调整措施，确保质量管理和风险控制的连续性与稳定性。

 

（亮点9：）质量检验 – 记录检验结果（F1685A）：应用扩展性

在本次版本更新中，“记录检验结果（Record Inspection Results，F1685A）”应用新增了自定义字段扩展能力。客户可将自定义字段作为检验批工作列表中的筛选条件或列进行显示，使应用在数据呈现和操作层面更加灵活，帮助质量技术员在录入检验结果时快速定位和获取检验批相关的关键信息，从而进一步优化质检流程、提升检验工作效率。

客户可通过具有SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC业务角色的账号登录系统，并进入“自定义字段（Custom Fields）”应用，在质量管理：检验批（Quality Management: Inspection Lot）业务上下文中对 Record Inspection Results 应用进行扩展，相关设置完成后即可在应用中直接使用。具体功能实现如有需要，请寻求客户方相关IT或者技术开发人员的支持，以测试并实现所需系统效果。

 

（亮点10：）质量检验 – 记录检验结果（F1685）应用将被弃用

在本次版本更新中，“记录检验结果（Record Inspection Results，F1685）”旧版本应用已被标记为弃用，并将在后续版本中被正式移除，其继任应用为“记录检验结果（Record Inspection Results，F1685A）”。为确保业务连续性，我们强烈建议客户尽早切换至 “记录检验结果 (F1685A)”。新应用在完整保留原有功能的基础上（包括自定义字段扩展），进一步增强了检验结果记录与缺陷管理的能力。

相比旧版本，“记录检验结果 (F1685A)” 支持在检验批、检验作业及检验特性层面手动创建并显示缺陷信息，同时可查看主检验特性、检验计划特性以及检验方法的详细说明。通过升级至继任应用，企业不仅能够延续既有业务流程，还可获得更全面、直观的检验管理能力，提升操作效率与质量管理的透明度。

 

（亮点11：）质量改进 – 缺陷与质量通知的外部输出管理

在本次版本更新中，SAP Cloud ERP（SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition）2602 版本的质量管理模块新增了外部输出管理能力，支持将缺陷处理和质量通知中的详细数据以 XML 格式发送至外部系统。该功能面向高容量输出、专用表单布局以及更复杂的输出场景设计，进一步增强了质量管理数据的可复用性和系统集成能力。

外部输出管理适用于多类质量业务对象，包括缺陷处理中的缺陷总览（DEFECT_OVERVIEW），以及质量通知场景下的客户投诉、供应商投诉和内部问题通知摘要（SUMMARY_CUSTOMER、SUMMARY_SUPPLIER、SUMMARY_INTERNAL）。在具体实施落地层面，客户需要启用外部输出管理相关范围项（Scope Item 7DJ），并通过通信场景 SAP_COM_0881 建立通信安排；随后在“管理输出队列”应用中定义输出队列，并在“输出参数确定”应用中完成输出类型配置，包括选择 EXTOM 作为输出渠道、分配输出队列以及指定对应的表单模板。借助这一能力，企业可以将质量管理数据以更标准、安全和自动化的方式交付给外部系统，有效提升复杂输出场景下的数据处理效率和业务响应能力。

 

 

 

以上是SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602版本中供应链管理和质量管理的亮点更新内容，更多更新请查阅What's New in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP 2602 (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) — 上载并过账包含 999 个以上行项目的日记账分录
entry.content:
业务背景

  • 随着企业业务扩展，单次批量生成的会计凭证明细（行项目）越来越多，可能会出现针对单张凭证行数超过999行的情况。
  • 在S/4 HANA Could Public Edition 2602版本前，如需通过App: 上传一般日记账分录 上传超过999行的凭证，需在抬头上新增技术名称为BSTAT的字段，并输入 U（代表“仅在总账中过账”）后进行上传，但该方案仅能按账套过账且存在一定限制（详见：2789867 - How to upload more than 999 entries in "upload general journal entries" - SAP for Me）

 

功能说明

在S/4 HANA Could Public Edition 2602后，App: 上传一般日记账 分录提供了新的技术字段：EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账），此新功能使您能够上载和过账包含 999 个以上行项目的一般日记账分录。

使用EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）字段支持3种模式，可能的值为1、2或3，对应功能为如下：

  • 1. 如果可能，禁止信息。在没有分录视图的情况下过账时使用此选项（仅含总账视图）。如果无法禁止，分录视图将过账并可能达到 999 行项目限制
  • 2. 最大汇总。过账尽可能多的汇总分录视图时使用此选项
  • 3. 如果可能，禁止信息。如果无法禁止，则应用最大汇总

对比如下：

对比维度

选项1

选项2

选项3

处理策略

完全跳过BSEG表更新

汇总后更新BSEG表

优先跳过BSEG表更新，失败时汇总更新

BSEG表更新

完全不更新

汇总后更新，显著减少行数

根据情况选择不更新或汇总更新

分类账视图/分录视图

仅有分类账视图

分类账视图包含完整信息，分录视图包含汇总后更新信息

根据情况动态选择

适用场景

纯总账过账，无税务处理

需要保留分录视图但要减少行数

混合业务场景，需要灵活处理

超过999行过账限制

彻底解决，无行数约束

大幅缓解，仍可能在极端情况下达到限制

智能处理，确保成功过账

因此，建议针对EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）输入“3” ，可支持大部分的过账情况。

 

前提条件

  • 在App: 上传一般日记账分录 中，下载一般日记账分录导入模板，并手工在模板的模板的抬头部分添加字段列并将字段命名为 EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）

 

  • 根据业务需求，在EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）字段中维护值1、2或3

 

测试场景

测试场景1：超过 999 行且无未清项管理/税项

会计凭证导入模板维护：EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）维护值为“3”

过账结果：

该凭证仅有“分类账视图”，无分录视图。分类账视图中包含了导入模板中的完整信息：

 

测试场景2：超过 999 行且含未清项管理/税项：

会计凭证导入模板维护：EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）维护值为“3”

过账结果：

在“分类账视图”中，凭证包含了完整的凭证行信息及成本中心/税码等信息

 

在“分录视图”中，EV_POSTNG_CTRL（条目视图的控制过账）维护值为“3”，系统汇总凭证行后更新“分录视图”。由下图可见，在“分录视图”中，成本对象的信息会被忽略，并按照税码信息将凭证行进行汇总。

对于超过 999 行且含未清/税项时，“分录视图”汇总有以下限制：

  • 含有分配或行文本等唯一属性的未清项管理科目不可汇总
  • 有唯一的行项目文本或分配的项目不可汇总

 

其他与会计凭证行超过999行过账相关的信息

  • SAP关于会计凭证行999行限制原因及解决方案：999 – The Number of the BSEG - SAP Community
  • 从S/4 HANA Could Public Edition 2402 版本起，通过SSCUI: 分录视图汇总(Entry View Summarization)，通过该配置有助于过账具有大量行项目（如超过999行）的日记账分录，并防止大量数据的性能和数据存储问题，详情可参考：分录视图汇总 | SAP Help Portal。如您的系统是在S/4 HANA Could Public Edition 2502 版本后申请激活，分录视图汇总配置会默认勾选。激活了”分录视图汇总”配置后，系统会将分录视图中具有相同特征的总账科目行项目进行合并，大幅减少了凭证里分录视图的行项目数量，避免因明细过多导致的性能瓶颈或“999行上限”错误。同时，详细的凭证数据依然完整保存在“分类账视图”中。
  • 需注意，至SAP Cloud ERP 2602，SSCUI: 分录视图汇总(Entry View Summarization)的配置针对App: 过账一般日记账分录 不生效。针对App: 上传一般日记账分录, 需要按照本文介绍通过添加字段EV_POSTNG_CTRL实现
  • 如需通过API过账超过999行的会计凭证，请参考：2804870 - More than 999 line items posting is supported in Journal Entry Posting API - SAP for Me

 

总结

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 通过新增 EV_POSTNG_CTRL 字段，支持在“上传一般日记账分录”应用中灵活上传和过账超过 999 行的会计凭证，从而突破以往的行数限制。
  • 通过EV_POSTNG_CTRL字段的不同模式优化大量凭证行过账时的数据处理，同时确保分类账视图中明细信息的完整性。

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602亮点前瞻——服务话题
entry.content:
本篇博客展示在 SAP Cloud ERP 2602版本当中服务版块发布的新功能以及重大变化须知，将会覆盖以下话题内容：

  • 服务订单管理
  • 服务中的产品层次结构
  • 服务中的客户层次结构
  • 更改服务单据性能改进

服务订单管理

支持服务订单中的不可开票 WBS 要素 在现有“管理服务订单”Fiori F3571A应用的基础上，扩展了支持的WBS要素类型。 在服务合同、服务订单或维修订单等服务交易中，您可以查看、选择并分配 WBS 要素作为获利能力细分的属性。WBS 要素是工作分解结构中的结构要素，表示特定企业项目的层次结构组织。在服务交易中，WBS 要素用作获利能力细分的属性，允许您将项目与服务交易的成本和收入相关联。 2602版本升级之前，创建服务订单时， 当选择的项目参数文件是间接费用项目，会遇到报错进而无法继续。

升级之后则无报错可继续创建服务订单成功。

跨主题

服务中的产品层次结构

您可以将应用中的产品层次结构用于服务交易，例如管理服务订单应用。当您想要沿多个级别组织产品（即物料）时，产品层次结构非常有用，适用于定价等用例。当价格计算设置为取决于产品层次结构数据时，您可以在服务交易中使用产品层次结构来确定价格。

第一步：设置产品层次结构

首先需要配置节点，才能被选到（SSCUI 103298）

添加角色SAP_BR_PRODMASTER_SPECIALIST 才能在‘在管理产品层次结构’应用中出现‘新建’按钮。可以添加节点或者产品。

第二步：配置用于确定产品层次结构的日期（可选）

要确定服务交易的产品层次结构，系统会将产品层次结构的 有效期自/至 字段中的日期与服务交易中的相关日期进行比较。

您可以将相关日期定义为服务交易创建日期，也可以是定价日期。您可以使用定义产品层次结构确定的相关日期（标识：103303）配置活动在配置环境中配置相关日期.

第三步：设置到产品层次结构的分配

应用：管理产品层次结构分配

第四步：配置定价

第五步：激活服务交易的产品层次结构

在配置环境中使用设置服务交易类型的产品层次结构相关性（标识：107215）配置活动激活服务交易的产品层次结构

服务中的客户层次结构

您可以将应用中的客户层次结构用于服务交易，例如管理服务订单应用。客户层次结构通常是必要的，有助于跨多个级别组织客户，以用于定价等用途。如果将价格计算设置为与客户层次结构数据相关，则可以在服务交易中使用客户层次结构进行价格确定。

激活服务交易的客户层次结构

在配置环境中使用设置服务交易类型的客户层次结构相关性（标识：107216）配置活动激活服务交易的客户层次结构。

更改服务单据性能改进

当系统针对服务交易（包括解决方案订单）执行编辑操作时，您可以从 Service 的性能改进中受益。当您的服务交易包含大量项目时，此改进非常突出。此功能将在系统中自动激活，但您可以选择在配置活动激活功能中取消激活服务事务的性能改进 (CRMS4_SC_EDIT_PERFORMANCE) 功能。

路径

CBC -> Activate features (SSCUI 106573)-> CRMS4_SC_EDIT_PERFORMANCE

移除 Service API 和业务对象接口的冗余消息

对于基于 Service 中业务对象接口的所有业务对象接口和 API（下面在技术详细信息中列出），系统不再包含系统消息 CRMS4_ORDER_RAP/001。此消息冗余。之前，在用户成功保存服务交易后，它显示在服务响应抬头中。

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602亮点前瞻：制造
entry.content:
欢迎大家来到我的博客。本篇博客将为大家介绍Cloud ERP中2602版本与制造模块的相关更新内容。

研发工程和生产工程管理

BOM 管理：

Fiori APP: 展开物料清单 （F4584）

更新内容：提升用户使用体验，页面简洁，数据集中，将过滤器中的BOM usage 和 Usage Text 移除，通过BOM 类别区分对物料BOM或者是订单BOM的展开。

旧版：

更新后：

Routing 管理：

Fiori APP：管理工艺路线（F5425）

更新内容：新增“复制”和“查找以复制*”功能。通过复制功能缩短复制和创建新工艺路线所需的时间。和减少手动输入和相关数据错误。“查找以复制*”功能是通过输入关键信息如物料号/工厂/备选物料清单等，借助AI工具查找类似的工艺路线进行复制。

旧版：

新版：

*AI 相关功能的使用可能因用户所处的地区不同而暂时性无法使用，具体可使用时间，需等待官方具体发布信息。

生产计划管理

Fiori App：审核订单进度-多级维度（F7681）

更新内容：在审核订单进度 - 多级视图应用中，改进了订单编号的过滤选项。根据被选择的凭证类型（流程订单、生产订单、销售订单），提供不同的过滤器字段作为必填字段确保指定的订单编号与此凭证类型匹配。

旧版：使用界面通过凭证类型下拉框确定生产/销售/流程订单，用户需使用可选框穿透获取精确的订单号码等。

新版：

在页面的可选菜单即可使用凭证类型等获取精确的数据。不再需要第二界面的穿透。

此外，现在还可以创建视图，用于保存订单组件表的个性化设置。

Fiori App：管理物料覆盖范围（F0251A）

更新内容：管理物料覆盖范围 (F0251A)

现在包括提供快速轻松的附加导航选项访问物料和 MRP 元素的详细信息。为了帮助您更快地分析和解决覆盖范围问题，针对以下内容添加了导航选项:

MRP 元素：

  • 收货要素：
  • 采购订单
  • 采购申请
  • 计划订单
  • 库存调拨单
  • 库存调拨申请
  • 库存

需求元素：

  • 销售订单
  • 交货
  • 订单预留
  • 相关需求
  • 计划独立需求
  • 库存转储单下达
  • 库存转储申请审批

您可以从为 中的 MRP 元素提供的快速视图中访问这些导航选项

库存/需求清单。

相关应用菜单中还提供了附加导航选项，以简化对物料的访问包括主数据问题和物料库存详细信息的主数据。

另外，通过权限管理，用于每个用户的导航目标与分配的权限相对应。例如，仅当将采购员角色分配给您的用户时，才能导航到管理采购订单应用。

 

计划订单管理

集成API: 计划订单的外部计划/计划计划订单工序（API: API_PLANNEDORDER）

通过外部计划器计划的计划数据更新到 S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition，可以导入所有工序甚至一些所选工序的计划详细信息。还可以在不同的工作中心计划外部管理的工序。

要在外部计划计划订单，请使用 http 方法 POST。

如果工作中心发生变化，那么在请求的负载里面可以加上字段“工序”，“计划订单”，“工作中心”等

使用此操作时，请考虑以下几点：

  • 仅离散行业支持此操作。
  • 重新计划计划订单时，除非生产版本发生更改，否则任何外部计划工序都不会受到影响。
  • 您可以通过在有效负载中包含日期和时间，使用计划计划订单工序更改外部计划到内部中点计划的工序。
  • OpExternalStatusIsActive 字段提供有关计划订单是否在外部管理的信息。
  • 仅在计划订单的工序级别支持更改，在子工序级别不支持更改。当使用日期和时间更改工序并且该工序也具有子工序时，子工序也会使用与主工序相同的日期和时间进行更新。
  • 如果工序是外部计划的，则不会考虑定制的计划参数。
  • 生产版本、工艺路线、工作中心工作时间和产能等主数据可能与工序不同步。
  • 工序产能或活动的持续时间可能与 订单开始日期 和 订单结束日期 不匹配。
  • 外部管理的工序不考虑工作中心工作时间和产能。
  • 工作中心的更改只是工作中心班次，不会实际执行计划，也就是说，在请求之前不会更改日期。
  • 如果工作中心发生更改，则工序的状态将始终为已分派。
  • 不支持使用此操作，仅更改内部计划的计划订单工序的工作中心。可以改用 SchedulePlannedOrderOperation。
  • 如果工序在外部计划，则计划订单中的所有其他工序可能与外部计划工序的日期不同步。

执行计划订单的部分转换时：

  • 重新计划计划订单。
  • 日期、时间和工作中心将在生产订单工序中重置。
  • 未在生产订单工序中设置 DSEX 和 DSPT 标志。

执行计划订单的完整转换时：

  • 更新的日期、时间和工作中心保留在生产订单工序中。
  • 为生产订单中的外部工序设置 DSEX 和 DSPT 标志。

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)2602亮点前瞻：财务
entry.content:
在本博文中，将介绍 SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) 2602 中财务的部分功能，覆盖以下内容：

  [计划安排]

三系统升级及维护计划

两系统升级及维护计划

【新功能】

管理会计和利润率分析

 1.管理利润中心（新版本）

通过新应用（应用标识：F3516A），您同样可以管理利润中心主数据。

它是“管理利润中心（旧）（应用标识：F3516）”的后继版本。

 新应用支持执行旧版本执行的所有操作，另外还包含新的附加功能，使您能够

 更便利的，有效地管理利润中心主数据。

这些附加功能包括：

  1. 改进了利润中心的有效期概览展示。
  2. 能够直接从清单页面创建新的有效期。
  3. 只需几步就可以轻松的将公司代码批量分配到利润中心。
  4. 提供利润中心的变更日志的查询功能，比如：公司代码到利润中心分配的日志。
    • 按日志类型过滤，例如成功或错误。
    • 按分配流程步骤过滤：上载、验证、导入。
    • •查看包含详细消息的日志详细信息页面

2.通用分配

应用管理分配支持如下新功能：

  1. 在公司间分配中支持同一公司的对象之间分配

分配类型公司间分配已得到增强，现在开始支持在同一公司代码中的对象之间进行分配。这允许更灵活的成本分配场景。用户操作界面没有更改，以适应用户已经形成的操作习惯。

唯一的区别在于，使用公司间分配,您现在可以选择同一公司代码中的对象,这样您可以在单个周期中执行这种业务场景的成本分配。

示例：比如需要从汇总质量控制服务费用的归集成本中心分配出它的成本。接收方对象包括成本中心和工作分解结构要素（WBS）的混合，其中一些属于与发送方相同的公司代码，而其他属于不同的公司代码。

2.间隔中的接收方特征为空

现在，在管理分配 (F3338A) 应用的细分中指定接收方时，可以在值类型区间里使用空格作为开始输入。这就允许成本分配的接收方可能缺少某些特征，但仍与分配过账相关。

3.公司间成本分配对账审核手册

这个应用是在2508版本发布的，在新版本里已支持服务凭证的公司间差旅成本过账。这些过账使用与项目或成本中心的公司间过账相同的过账方案过账。这意味着成本首先作为公司内部凭证过账到员工的成本中心，然后传输并过账到接收公司代码中的服务凭证。

此功能在系统中不会自动可用，而是需要在配置活动激活功能中激活公司间成本分配对账 (CO_ICO_DOCFLOW) 功能。

显示接收方日记账分录 (FI) 数据的前提条件

除非您在激活功能配置活动中激活功能通过 bgPF 的典型公司间发票的应付账款过账 (S4HC_SDBIL_ICO_IDOC_REMOVAL)，否则将不会显示接收方日记账分录 (FI) 维度的数据。有关此功能的详细信息，请参阅：将应付账款自动过账到销售公司的科目。

权限
要使用户能够访问此应用，需要为其业务用户分配以下业务目录：间接费用成本会计 - 常规报表 (SAP_FIN_BC_OH_REP_GEN_PC)。

配置
此功能依赖于新公司间开票解决方案生成的数据，因此您必须已执行新资源相关公司间开票的配置。有关详细信息，请参阅生成公司间开票请求（新解决方案）。

凭证流受以下因素影响：

  • 通过旧解决方案完成的公司间开票（使用借项凭证请求）在凭证流中显示为未开票。
  • 使用旧解决方案完成的公司间开票，然后使用新解决方案取消或冲销并重新开票，显示在具有新开票凭证请求和开票凭证类型的流中。
  • 如果在配置步骤激活一般日记账分录的使用 (107009) 中为新资源相关公司间开票激活一般日记账分录的使用，则记录不会包含在凭证流中。

备注

这是此应用的初始版本，并且存在一些功能限制。在未来版本中可能会发生更改。这些更改可能会导致：

  • 应用缺省行为的差异。
  • 用户界面内容和布局中的差异。
  • 应用内的一些数据丢失。例如，您在我的视图中配置的任何视图都可能会丢失。

此版本在管理 KPI 和报表应用中不可用。

需要激活范围项目4AN（跨公司成本会计过账的公司间开票）

6.“含生产差异的产品获利能力”应用的后继 (W0182)

自 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 起，此应用的后继版本是产品获利能力审核手册 (F8348) 应用。此新应用版本将在未来替换含生产差异的产品获利能力应用。我们建议您尽快切换到后继应用产品获利能力审核手册。

12. GR/IR（收到货物/发票收到）科目使用扩展未清项目管理在自动清算中组标识符的增强显示

在使用 通过延伸的 OIM 收货/收发票自动清账 作业模板中，运行结果会显示增强的组标识符。

标识符由采购订单编号、采购订单项目以及事务代码组成。这有助于确保仅清算具有相同事务代码的行项目。系统使用组来确保根据收发票正确清算收货。这些组由使用各种特征分组在一起的未清项目组成。它们基于采购订单和采购订单项目创建，并与事务代码一起显示在组标识符中。由于仅必须清算具有相同事务代码的行项目，因此后缀中的组标识符一目了然地显示涉及的交易代码。这有助于用户避免清算具有不同事务代码的行项目。

可用事务代码包括：

  • WRX – 收货/收发票清算
  • FR1 - 运费清算
  • FR3 – 关税清算

如果准备使用通过延伸的 OIM 收货/收发票自动清账作业，则必须激活扩展未清项目管理，这可以允许日记账分录具有超过 999 个行项目。

请注意带来的相关的限制，有关详细信息，请参阅激活收货/收发票科目的扩展未清项目管理。

比如：

  1. 使用扩展未清项目管理时，必须使用此作业。自动清账作业不能与扩展未清项目管理一起使用。
  2. 为收货/收发票科目激活扩展未清项目管理后，将无法再对收货/收发票科目执行外币评估。

资产会计

15.固定资产部分报废：支持基于购置年度来定义处理顺序

使用

对于更改余额的资产交易，可以参考当前年度购置来区分，并参考上一年度购置来区分。某些交易只能针对当前年度的价值，也可以针对先前年度的价值。

例如，部分报废就是这种情况：如果资产具有来自不同会计年度的多个购置价值，则系统提供的新功能会在进行报废过账时提供考虑这些购置的可能性。这意味着，根据您是想要先报废较旧还是较新的资产余额，这样操作可能会产生不同的折旧金额。

具体的，可以使用“购置年度”选项定义处理顺序

您可以通过在参考部分中选择购置年度字段的选项来影响资产特定过账应用（例如过账资产报废应用）中的处理顺序。

根据资产交易，您可以选择以下一个或多个选项：

购置年度：选项

解释

仅本年度

系统仅考虑本年度购置产生的余额。

仅先前年度

系统仅考虑先前年度购置产生的余额。

首先当前年度，然后是先前年度

系统首先考虑当前年度购置产生的余额，然后考虑先前年度产生的余额。

此选项对应于库存会计中的 LIFO（后进先出）方法。

先前年度优先，然后当前年度

系统首先考虑先前年度的余额，然后考虑当前年度的余额。

此选项对应于库存会计中的 FIFO（先进先出）方法。

进一步的详情，请参考产品帮助

17.基于活动的投资合并：股息分配

报告股息分配时，合并流程应继续进行股息的公司间抵销以及非控股权益 (NCI) 的调整。公司间抵销通过重新分类任务完成。在合并监控器应用中，您现在可以在财务报表项目 316000（留存收益）、子项目 906 和活动 18（股息分配）上报告被投资方的股息。投资合并任务支持基于相应报告数据和公司间抵销结果的相应 NCI 调整。

通过活动 02（后续合并）报告 W331-U 的净收入。然后通过活动 W331-A（股息分配）将其作为股息分配给其投资方 18。对于 W331-A，此股息作为投资收入报告，通过活动 02 更改 W331-A 的净收入。

在过账级别 20 执行公司间股息抵销的重新分类任务后，投资合并任务的日志将显示自动派生的活动股息分配。

此功能在合并监控器应用（F7271 和 CX20）的两个版本中均可用。

配置

在使用股息分配功能之前，必须执行以下活动：

作为新客户，您必须设置专用的重新分类任务。

作为 升级客户，您必须执行以下操作：

  • 设置专用的重新分类任务。
  • 创建两个新的财务报表项目作为专用清算项目及其少数股东：
    • 319100（股息 - 清算）
    • 321810（NCI - 股息清算）

资金管理 - 现金和流动性管理

19.实际流动性分析

新应用可以提供银行账户中现金流的实际流动性分析，确定现金来源和使用方式。此流程侧重于现金和流动性计划以及定期报告。它通过审核手册应用框架进行分析查询。

概念介绍

未实现的外汇差异

在限定期间内，您可能会遇到以各种交易货币计的现金流。要一致地报告这些现金流，需要将其转换为通用货币，通常是显示货币或公司代码的货币。通常在交易日期和期末（或报表关键日期）查看与转换货币不同的交易货币汇率。如果在过账日期使用汇率进行 FI 过账，但需要在期末进行重新评估，则会执行类似的流程（外汇评估）。 

现金流的未实现外汇差异

让我们定义一个包含开始和结束日期的报表期间。最重要的方面是在此期间发生的现金流。每个现金流通常具有不同的交易日期。仅关注与报表货币（通常是公司代码或显示货币）相比具有货币差异的现金流。自交易日期（金额 A）起，将交易货币金额转换为报告货币。此外，在期末使用外汇汇率转换交易金额（金额 B）。由于不同日期的费率不同，结果通常有所不同。金额 B 和金额 A 之间的差异表示未实现的外汇差异。

余额的未实现外汇差异

期初余额由先前期间的所有现金流组成。期末余额是期间内期初余额和所有现金流的总和。其中包括先前期间的现金流和期初余额。您需要计算期初余额的未实现外汇。使用期初汇率（金额 C）和期末汇率（金额 D）转换期初余额。金额 D 和金额 C 之间的差异表示未实现的外汇差异。

期末余额等于期初余额加上期间内的所有现金流。它包括先前期间的现金流和期初余额。相应地汇总未实现的外汇差异。

需要激活项目范围J78 (高级现金操作)
